description: Production-ready claims management system with performance optimization, compliance engine, and type safety improvements

features.name: Ultra-Modern Design Foundation
features.description: Establish CSS foundation for glassmorphism, gradients, and modern animations
prerequisites: Tailwind CSS is configured and working
index.css file exists for custom CSS
Development server is running on port 5000

userStories.story: As a developer, I can see ultra-modern gradient utilities in CSS so that components can use vibrant gradient backgrounds
userStories.implementation: Add ultra-modern gradient CSS variables to index.css with purple/pink/blue/green color schemes for hero, recovery, treatment, and mesh backgrounds
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove added gradient CSS variables from index.css

userStories.story: As a developer, I can apply glassmorphism effects to components so that they have modern backdrop blur and transparency
edgeCases: If backdrop-filter unsupported: use opaque background with reduced opacity
If browser performance poor: disable blur and use simple transparency
If mobile device: reduce glassmorphism complexity for performance
prerequisites: CSS custom properties for glassmorphism values
userStories.implementation: Add glassmorphism utility classes with backdrop-filter blur, semi-transparent backgrounds, and glass-like borders
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove .glass-panel CSS class and related utilities

userStories.story: As a developer, I can use modern animation utilities so that components have smooth floating and gradient animations
performanceFallbacks: If low-end device detected: use simpler opacity transitions
If frame rate below 30fps: automatically reduce animation complexity
userStories.implementation: Extend tailwind.config.ts with modern animation tokens including float, gradient, and pulse-slow animations

userStories.story: As a developer, I can use a reusable GlassPanel component so that glassmorphism can be consistently applied
userStories.implementation: Create reusable GlassPanel component in client/src/components/ui/glass-panel.tsx with gradient variant support
userStories.testSetup: Create test page or component using GlassPanel with class 'glass-panel-test'

features.name: Immersive Hero Section
features.description: Transform DynamicRecoveryTimeline into full-height immersive experience with gradient backgrounds and glassmorphism panels

userStories.story: As a user, I can see a full-height hero container when I visit the Treatment tab so that the layout takes up the proper viewport space
prerequisites: Treatment tab exists and is clickable
userStories.implementation: Transform DynamicRecoveryTimeline container to full-height layout structure with proper viewport sizing

userStories.story: As a user, I can see vibrant gradient backgrounds in the hero section so that the dashboard has modern visual appeal
userStories.implementation: Add gradient backgrounds to the hero section using CSS gradient utilities
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove gradient background styles from hero container

userStories.story: As a user, I can see vibrant gradient mesh backgrounds so that the dashboard has modern visual appeal
userStories.implementation: Add layered radial gradient mesh backgrounds using CSS gradient utilities

userStories.story: As a user, I can see animated gradient effects so that the dashboard feels dynamic and engaging
userStories.implementation: Add gradient animation classes and overlay effects to mesh backgrounds
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove animation classes and overlay elements

userStories.story: As a user, I can see a 12-column grid layout for recovery data so that information is properly structured
userStories.implementation: Create 12-column CSS grid layout for recovery timeline data
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove grid layout and restore original layout

userStories.story: As a user, I can see glassmorphism effects on recovery panels so that information has modern visual depth
userStories.implementation: Apply glassmorphism styling to recovery data panels using GlassPanel component
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove glassmorphism styling and use regular panels

userStories.story: As a user, I can see modern typography with proper hierarchy so that the hero section has professional presentation
prerequisites: White text is readable on gradient background
userStories.implementation: Add modern typography with white text, large headings, and proper spacing for hero section

features.name: Enhanced Chart Visualizations
features.description: Transform Recharts components with gradient fills, particle animations, and modern styling
prerequisites: Recharts library is installed and working

userStories.story: As a user, I can see recovery data as area charts instead of line charts so that the visualization has more visual weight
prerequisites: Recovery data structure supports area charts
userStories.implementation: Replace Recharts LineChart with AreaChart component

userStories.story: As a user, I can see gradient fills in area charts so that the visualization is more visually appealing
edgeCases: If gradients not supported: fallback to solid fill colors
If SVG rendering fails: show basic area chart without gradients
userStories.implementation: Add gradient fills to area charts using SVG linearGradient definitions
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove gradient definitions and use solid fills

userStories.story: As a user, I can see basic circular progress ring structure so that the foundation for progress visualization is established
prerequisites: SVG circle elements can be created
userStories.implementation: Create basic SVG circle structure for progress rings without animations

userStories.story: As a user, I can see progress rings animate their stroke so that completion percentage is visually communicated
userStories.implementation: Add stroke-dasharray animation to show progress completion percentage

userStories.story: As a user, I can see progress rings with subtle floating animation so that they feel dynamic and polished
userStories.implementation: Add floating animation to progress ring containers

userStories.story: As a user, I can see particle dots in the chart area so that the foundation for curve animations is established
prerequisites: Recovery curve path data is available
userStories.implementation: Create basic particle dot components with absolute positioning in a container
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove particle container and dot elements

userStories.story: As a user, I can see particles move along the recovery curve so that the chart shows dynamic progression
prerequisites: Particle dots are created and positioned
Recovery curve path data is available
userStories.implementation: Implement path following animation logic using CSS transforms to move particles along recovery curve
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove path animation CSS and transform styles

userStories.story: As a user, I can see particle dots pulse and fade so that the animation feels polished and engaging
userStories.implementation: Add pulse and fade effects to particle dots using CSS animations
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove pulse animation classes and opacity styles

userStories.story: As a user, I can see custom tooltip components so that chart data can be presented with enhanced styling
userStories.implementation: Create custom tooltip components to replace default Recharts tooltips

userStories.story: As a user, I can see tooltips with glassmorphism effects so that chart data presentation feels modern and polished
userStories.implementation: Apply glassmorphism styling and better typography to custom tooltips

features.name: Glassmorphism Treatment Cards
features.description: Apply modern glassmorphism effects to TreatmentPlanCard and related components

userStories.story: As a user, I can see the treatment plan in a glassmorphism card so that it has modern visual depth and consistency
browserCompatibility: If backdrop-filter unsupported: apply solid background with rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)
If CSS variables unsupported: use hardcoded RGBA values
prerequisites: TreatmentPlanCard can be wrapped in GlassPanel
userStories.implementation: Wrap TreatmentPlanCard content in GlassPanel component with appropriate gradient variant

userStories.story: As a user, I can see intervention badges with proper classification so that different priority levels are structured
userStories.implementation: Create intervention badge components with proper priority classification

userStories.story: As a user, I can see gradient backgrounds on intervention badges so that priorities are visually distinct
prerequisites: Gradient utilities for badges are available
userStories.implementation: Apply gradient backgrounds to intervention badges based on priority levels
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove gradient styles from intervention badges

userStories.story: As a user, I can see diagnosis card with glassmorphism effects so that medical context has modern visual presentation
userStories.implementation: Apply glassmorphism styling to diagnosis card using GlassPanel wrapper
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove glassmorphism wrapper from diagnosis card

userStories.story: As a user, I can see gradient status indicators on diagnosis card so that medical status is visually distinct
userStories.implementation: Add gradient status indicators to diagnosis card based on medical status
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove gradient styling from status indicators

userStories.story: As a user, I can see floating animations on badges so that they feel dynamic and engaging
performanceFallbacks: If reduced motion preference: show static badges with hover effects only
If poor performance detected: fall back to opacity fade instead of transform
userStories.implementation: Add floating animations to badge components using CSS animation utilities
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove floating animation classes from badges

userStories.story: As a user, I can see subtle pulse animations on status indicators so that important information draws appropriate attention
performanceFallbacks: If multiple indicators animating: stagger start times to reduce load
If reduced motion preference: disable pulse animations
userStories.implementation: Add pulse animations to confidence indicators and status elements
userStories.rollbackProcedure: Remove pulse animation classes from indicators

features.name: Framer Motion Animation Polish
features.description: Add smooth transitions, micro-interactions, and sophisticated animations using Framer Motion

userStories.story: As a user, I can see a motion-enabled hero container so that the foundation for entrance animations is established
prerequisites: Framer Motion components can be imported
userStories.implementation: Add Framer Motion wrapper components to hero section structure

userStories.story: As a user, I can see smooth fade-in animation when the Treatment tab loads so that the experience feels polished
userStories.implementation: Add fade-in entrance animation with proper timing and opacity transitions

userStories.story: As a user, I can see motion-enabled panels so that the foundation for staggered animations is ready
userStories.implementation: Add Framer Motion wrapper components to glassmorphism panels

userStories.story: As a user, I can see panels appear with elegant staggered timing so that the layout builds smoothly
userStories.implementation: Add staggered entrance animations with proper timing delays

userStories.story: As a user, I can see chart containers with loading animations so that data loading feels responsive
userStories.implementation: Add animation wrappers and loading transitions to chart containers

userStories.story: As a user, I can see smooth chart data animations so that the visualization feels alive and responsive
userStories.implementation: Add Framer Motion layout animations for smooth data loading effects

userStories.story: As a user, I can see subtle hover effects on interactive elements so that the interface feels responsive and modern
prerequisites: Hover states don't interfere with functionality
userStories.implementation: Add subtle hover micro-interactions using Framer Motion whileHover animations

fallbackStrategies: If server not responding: restart dev server
If API data missing: show loading states with skeleton UI
If gradients not rendering: provide solid color fallbacks
If animations laggy: reduce animation complexity or disable
If backdrop-filter unsupported: use solid background fallback

fallbackAnimations.particleSystem: Static dots instead of moving particles
fallbackAnimations.floatingBadges: Subtle opacity change instead of transform

acceptance.endToEndTest: User can navigate to Treatment tab and see immersive glassmorphism dashboard with gradient-filled charts, floating progress rings, and smooth animations

backdropFilter.fallbackStrategy: Opaque background with rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15) and subtle border
backdropFilter.gracefulDegradation: Maintain visual hierarchy without glass effect

gradientAnimations.fallback: Static gradients with hover color transitions
